‚Ñí(e‚Å¢v‚Å¢a‚Å¢l)superscript‚Ñíùëíùë£ùëéùëô\displaystyle\mathcal{L}^{(eval)}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_e italic_v italic_a italic_l ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =‚àëj=1Jmùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Ä≤‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j|zm‚Å¢j,ùùÅzm‚Å¢j,ùö∫zm‚Å¢j)]absentsuperscriptsubscriptùëó1subscriptùêΩùëösubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]superscriptùëù‚Ä≤conditionalsubscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùëßùëöùëósubscriptùùÅsubscriptùëßùëöùëósubscriptùö∫subscriptùëßùëöùëó\displaystyle=\sum\nolimits_{j=1}^{J_{m}}{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log p^{\prime}({\bf e% }_{mj}|z_{mj},\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{z_{mj}},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma% $\unboldmath}_{z_{mj}})]= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_J start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=‚àëm,j,kœïm‚Å¢j‚Å¢k‚Å¢{‚àí12‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j‚àíùùÅk)T‚Å¢ùö∫k‚àí1‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j‚àíùùÅk)‚àílog‚Å°[(2‚Å¢œÄ)d/2‚Å¢|ùö∫k|1/2]}.absentsubscriptùëöùëóùëòsubscriptitalic-œïùëöùëóùëò12superscriptsubscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùùÅùëòùëásuperscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëò1subscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùùÅùëòsuperscript2ùúãùëë2superscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëò12\displaystyle=\sum_{m,j,k}\phi_{mjk}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{% \boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}^{-1% }({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})-\log[(2\pi)^{d/2}|\mbox{% \boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}|^{1/2}]\}.= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_j , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_œÄ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } . (24)

I.1 Gaussian Mixture Models

Suppose we have a ground truth GMM model with parameters ùùÖ‚àó‚àà‚ÑùKsuperscriptùùÖsuperscript‚Ñùùêæ\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}^{*}\in\mathbb{R}^{K}bold_italic_œÄ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and {ùùÅk‚àó,ùö∫k‚àó}k=1KsuperscriptsubscriptsuperscriptsubscriptùùÅùëòsuperscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëòùëò1ùêæ\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k}^{*},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}% _{k}^{*}\}_{k=1}^{K}{ bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, with KùêæKitalic_K different Gaussian distributions. In the dataset, let NùëÅNitalic_N and NssubscriptùëÅùë†N_{s}italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT denote the numbers of non-stop-words and stop-words, respectively. Then the marginal log likelihood of a learned GMM model on a given data sample ùêûùêû{\bf e}bold_e can be written as

p‚Å¢(ùêû|{ùùÅ,ùö∫},ùùÖ)=‚àëk=1KùùÖk‚Å¢ùí©‚Å¢(ùêû;ùùÅk,ùö∫k).ùëùconditionalùêûùùÅùö∫ùùÖsuperscriptsubscriptùëò1ùêæsubscriptùùÖùëòùí©ùêûsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëò\displaystyle p({\bf e}|\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath},\mbox{\boldmath$% \Sigma$\unboldmath}\},\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath})=\sum_{k=1}^{K}\mbox{% \boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}).italic_p ( bold_e | { bold_italic_Œº , bold_Œ£ } , bold_italic_œÄ ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e ; bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (25)

Assuming a dataset of N+NsùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†N+N_{s}italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT words {ùêûi}i=1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùêûùëñùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†\{{\bf e}_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N+N_{s}}{ bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and taking the associated weights wisubscriptùë§ùëñw_{i}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for each word into account, the log-likelihood of the dataset can be written as

‚àëi=1N+Nsp‚Å¢(ùêûi|{ùùÅk,ùö∫k}k=1K,ùùÖ)=‚àëi=1Nlog‚Å¢‚àëk=1Kwi‚Å¢ùùÖk‚Å¢ùí©‚Å¢(ùêûi;ùùÅk,ùö∫k)+‚àëi=N+1N+Nslog‚Å¢‚àëk=1Kwi‚Å¢ùùÖk‚Å¢ùí©‚Å¢(ùêûi;ùùÅk,ùö∫k).superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†ùëùconditionalsubscriptùêûùëñsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòùëò1ùêæùùÖsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsuperscriptsubscriptùëò1ùêæsubscriptùë§ùëñsubscriptùùÖùëòùí©subscriptùêûùëñsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòsuperscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†superscriptsubscriptùëò1ùêæsubscriptùë§ùëñsubscriptùùÖùëòùí©subscriptùêûùëñsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëò\displaystyle\sum_{i=1}^{N+N_{s}}p({\bf e}_{i}|\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}\}_{k=1}^{K},\mbox{% \boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath})=\sum_{i=1}^{N}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}w_{i}\mbox{% \boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+\sum_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s% }}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}w_{i}\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e% }_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}% _{k}).‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | { bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_italic_œÄ ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (26)

Leveraging Jensen‚Äôs inequality, we obtain a lower bound of the above quantity (denoting as ùöØùöØ\Thetabold_Œò the collection of parameters {ùùÅk,ùö∫k}k=1KsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòùëò1ùêæ\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}% \}_{k=1}^{K}{ bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ùùÖùùÖ\pibold_italic_œÄ):

‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØ,{wi})=‚àëi=1Nwi‚Å¢log‚Å¢‚àëk=1KœÄk‚Å¢ùí©‚Å¢(ùêûi;ùùÅk,ùö∫k)+‚àëi=N+1N+Nswi‚Å¢log‚Å¢‚àëk=1KœÄk‚Å¢ùí©‚Å¢(ùêûi;ùùÅk,ùö∫k)+C,subscript‚ÑíGMMùöØsubscriptùë§ùëñsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùë§ùëñsuperscriptsubscriptùëò1ùêæsubscriptùúãùëòùí©subscriptùêûùëñsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòsuperscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùë§ùëñsuperscriptsubscriptùëò1ùêæsubscriptùúãùëòùí©subscriptùêûùëñsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòùê∂\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath},\{w_% {i}\})=\sum_{i=1}^{N}w_{i}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+% \sum_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}w_{i}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+C,caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò , { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_C , (27)

where C is a constant.

In the following theoretical analysis, we consider the following three different configurations of the weights wisubscriptùë§ùëñw_{i}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Definition I.1 (Weight Configurations).

We define three different weight configurations as follows:

  • ‚Ä¢

    Identical Weights: wi=1N+Nssubscriptùë§ùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†w_{i}=\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N+Ns}ùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†i\in\{1,2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }

  • ‚Ä¢

    Ground-Truth Weights : wi={1N,i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N}0,i‚àà{N+1,N+2,‚Ä¶,N+Ns}subscriptùë§ùëñcases1ùëÅùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅotherwise0ùëñùëÅ1ùëÅ2‚Ä¶ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\tfrac{1}{N},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ 0,~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , italic_i ‚àà { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

  • ‚Ä¢

    Attention-Based Weights: wi={Œª1‚àà[1N+Ns,1N],i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N}Œª2‚àà[0,1N+Ns],i‚àà{N+1,N+2,‚Ä¶,N+Ns}subscriptùë§ùëñcasesformulae-sequencesubscriptùúÜ11ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†1ùëÅùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅotherwiseformulae-sequencesubscriptùúÜ201ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†ùëñùëÅ1ùëÅ2‚Ä¶ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\lambda_{1}\in[\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}},\tfrac{1}{N}],~{}~{}i\in% \{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ \lambda_{2}\in[0,\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}],~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ] , italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà [ 0 , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] , italic_i ‚àà { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

Definition I.2 (Advanced Weight Configurations).

We define three different weight configurations as follows:

  • ‚Ä¢

    Identical Weights: wi=1N+Nssubscriptùë§ùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†w_{i}=\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N+Ns}ùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†i\in\{1,2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }

  • ‚Ä¢

    Ground-Truth Weights : wi={1N,i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N}0,i‚àà{N+1,N+2,‚Ä¶,N+Ns}subscriptùë§ùëñcases1ùëÅùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅotherwise0ùëñùëÅ1ùëÅ2‚Ä¶ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\tfrac{1}{N},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ 0,~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , italic_i ‚àà { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

  • ‚Ä¢

    Attention-Based Weights: wi‚àà{[1N+Ns,1N],i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N}[0,1N+Ns],i‚àà{N+1,N+2,‚Ä¶,N+Ns}subscriptùë§ùëñcases1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†1ùëÅùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅotherwise01ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†ùëñùëÅ1ùëÅ2‚Ä¶ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†otherwisew_{i}\in\begin{cases}[\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}},\tfrac{1}{N}],~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N% \}\\ [0,\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}],~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà { start_ROW start_CELL [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ] , italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL [ 0 , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] , italic_i ‚àà { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

Definition I.3 (Optimal Parameters).

With Definition I.1, the corresponding optimal parameters are then defined as follows:

ùöØI=arg‚Å°maxùöØ‚Å°‚Ñí‚Å¢(ùöØ;ùê∞‚ÜíIdentical),subscriptùöØùêºsubscriptùöØ‚Ñí‚ÜíùöØùê∞Identical\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{Identical}),bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Œò end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Œò ; bold_w ‚Üí Identical ) , (28)
ùöØG=arg‚Å°maxùöØ‚Å°‚Ñí‚Å¢(ùöØ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT),subscriptùöØùê∫subscriptùöØ‚Ñí‚ÜíùöØùê∞GT\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{GT}),bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Œò end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Œò ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) , (29)
ùöØA=arg‚Å°maxùöØ‚Å°‚Ñí‚Å¢(ùöØ;ùê∞‚ÜíAttention),subscriptùöØùê¥subscriptùöØ‚Ñí‚ÜíùöØùê∞Attention\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{Attention}),bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Œò end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Œò ; bold_w ‚Üí Attention ) , (30)

where ùê∞‚ÜíIdentical‚Üíùê∞Identical{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{Identical}bold_w ‚Üí Identical, ùê∞‚ÜíGT‚Üíùê∞GT{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT}bold_w ‚Üí GT, and ùê∞‚ÜíAttention‚Üíùê∞Attention{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{Attention}bold_w ‚Üí Attention indicates that ‚ÄòIdentical Weights‚Äô, ‚ÄòGround-Truth Weights‚Äô, and ‚ÄòAttention-Based Weights‚Äô are used, respectively.

Lemma I.1.

Suppose we have two series of functions {f1,i‚Å¢(x)}subscriptùëì1ùëñùë•\{f_{1,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) } and {f2,i‚Å¢(x)}subscriptùëì2ùëñùë•\{f_{2,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) }, with two non-negative weighting parameters Œª1,Œª2subscriptùúÜ1subscriptùúÜ2\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying N‚Å¢Œª1+Ns‚Å¢Œª2=1ùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùúÜ21N\lambda_{1}+N_{s}\lambda_{2}=1italic_N italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1. We define the final objective function f‚Å¢(‚ãÖ)ùëì‚ãÖf(\cdot)italic_f ( ‚ãÖ ) as:

f‚Å¢(x;Œª1,Œª2)=Œª1‚Å¢‚àëi=1Nf1,i‚Å¢(x)+Œª2‚Å¢‚àëi=N+1Nsf2,i‚Å¢(x).ùëìùë•subscriptùúÜ1subscriptùúÜ2subscriptùúÜ1superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëì1ùëñùë•subscriptùúÜ2superscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùëì2ùëñùë•\displaystyle f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})=\lambda_{1}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(x)% +\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(x).italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) + italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) . (31)

We assume two pairs of parameters (Œª1,Œª2)subscriptùúÜ1subscriptùúÜ2(\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})( italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and (Œª1‚Ä≤,Œª2‚Ä≤)subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2(\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2})( italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where

Œª1‚â•Œª1‚Ä≤,subscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1},italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (32)
Œª2‚â§Œª2‚Ä≤.subscriptùúÜ2subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2\displaystyle\lambda_{2}\leq\lambda^{\prime}_{2}.italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (33)

Defining the optimal values of the objective function for different weighting parameters as

x^=arg‚Å°maxx‚Å°f‚Å¢(x;Œª1,Œª2),^ùë•subscriptùë•ùëìùë•subscriptùúÜ1subscriptùúÜ2\displaystyle\widehat{x}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (34)
x^‚Ä≤=arg‚Å°maxx‚Å°f‚Å¢(x;Œª1‚Ä≤,Œª2‚Ä≤),superscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptùë•ùëìùë•subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2\displaystyle\widehat{x}^{\prime}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda% ^{\prime}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (35)

we then have that

f‚Å¢(x^;1N,0)‚â•f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;1N,0).ùëì^ùë•1ùëÅ0ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤1ùëÅ0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)\geq f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{% 1}{N},0).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) ‚â• italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) . (36)
Proof.

We prove this theorem by contradiction. Suppose that we have

f‚Å¢(x^;1N,0)<f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;1N,0).ùëì^ùë•1ùëÅ0ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤1ùëÅ0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)<f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{1}{N% },0).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) < italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) . (37)

According to Eq. 32, i.e., Œª1‚â•Œª1‚Ä≤subscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1\lambda_{1}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and the equation N‚Å¢Œª1+Ns‚Å¢Œª2=1ùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùúÜ21N\lambda_{1}+N_{s}\lambda_{2}=1italic_N italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, we have

Œª1‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤=Œª1‚Å¢1‚àíN‚Å¢Œª1‚Ä≤Ns‚â•Œª1‚Ä≤‚Å¢1‚àíN‚Å¢Œª1Ns=Œª1‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2.subscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2subscriptùúÜ11ùëÅsubscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤11ùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptùúÜ2\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}=\lambda_{1}\tfrac{1-N\lambda^{% \prime}_{1}}{N_{s}}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\tfrac{1-N\lambda_{1}}{N_{s}}=% \lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2}.italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_N italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚â• italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_N italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (38)

According to Eq. 35, we have the following equality:

f‚Å¢(x^;Œª1‚Ä≤,Œª2‚Ä≤)‚â§f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;Œª1‚Ä≤,Œª2‚Ä≤).ùëì^ùë•subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2})\leq f(% \widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2}).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚â§ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (39)

Combined with the aforementioned assumption in Eq. 37, we have that

Œª2‚Ä≤‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x^;Œª1,Œª2)=Œª1‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤‚Å¢‚àëi=1Nf1,i‚Å¢(x^)+Œª2‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤‚Å¢‚àëi=N+1Nsf2,i‚Å¢(x^)subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2ùëì^ùë•subscriptùúÜ1subscriptùúÜ2subscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëì1ùëñ^ùë•subscriptùúÜ2subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2superscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùëì2ùëñ^ùë•\displaystyle\lambda^{\prime}_{2}f(\widehat{x};\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})=% \lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x})+\lambda_{2}% \lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{x})italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) + italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) (40)
=\displaystyle== (Œª1‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2‚Å¢‚àëi=1Nf1,i‚Å¢(x^)+Œª2‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2‚Å¢‚àëi=N+1Nsf2,i‚Å¢(x^))+(N‚Å¢(Œª1‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤‚àíŒª1‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2)‚ãÖ1N‚Å¢‚àëi=1Nf1,i‚Å¢(x^))subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptùúÜ2superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëì1ùëñ^ùë•subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2subscriptùúÜ2superscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùëì2ùëñ^ùë•‚ãÖùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptùúÜ21ùëÅsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëì1ùëñ^ùë•\displaystyle(\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}% )+\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{x}))+(N(% \lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2})\cdot\tfrac{1}% {N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}))( italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) + italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) ) + ( italic_N ( italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) ) (41)
=\displaystyle== Œª2‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x^;Œª1‚Ä≤,Œª2‚Ä≤)+N‚Å¢(Œª1‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤‚àíŒª1‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2)‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x^;1N,0)subscriptùúÜ2ùëì^ùë•subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2ùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptùúÜ2ùëì^ùë•1ùëÅ0\displaystyle{\lambda_{2}}f(\widehat{x};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_% {2})+N(\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2})f(% \widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_N ( italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) (42)
<\displaystyle<< Œª2‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;Œª1‚Ä≤,Œª2‚Ä≤)+N‚Å¢(Œª1‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤‚àíŒª1‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2)‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;1N,0)subscriptùúÜ2ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2ùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptùúÜ2ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤1ùëÅ0\displaystyle{\lambda_{2}}f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^% {\prime}_{2})+N(\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-{\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{% 2}})f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{1}{N},0)italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_N ( italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) (43)
=\displaystyle== (Œª1‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2‚Å¢‚àëi=1Nf1,i‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤)+Œª2‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2‚Å¢‚àëi=N+1Nsf2,i‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤))+(N‚Å¢(Œª1‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤‚àíŒª1‚Ä≤‚Å¢Œª2)‚ãÖ1N‚Å¢‚àëi=1Nf1,i‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤))subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptùúÜ2superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëì1ùëñsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2subscriptùúÜ2superscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùëì2ùëñsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤‚ãÖùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1subscriptùúÜ21ùëÅsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëì1ùëñsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤\displaystyle(\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}% ^{\prime})+\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat% {x}^{\prime}))+(N(\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_% {2})\cdot\tfrac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}^{\prime}))( italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) + ( italic_N ( italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) (44)
=\displaystyle== Œª1‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤‚Å¢‚àëi=1Nf1,i‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤)+Œª2‚Å¢Œª2‚Ä≤‚Å¢‚àëi=N+1Nsf2,i‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤)subscriptùúÜ1subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùëì1ùëñsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptùúÜ2subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2superscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùëì2ùëñsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}^% {\prime})+\lambda_{2}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{% x}^{\prime})italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (45)
=\displaystyle== Œª2‚Ä≤‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;Œª1,Œª2),subscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptùúÜ1subscriptùúÜ2\displaystyle\lambda^{\prime}_{2}f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2% }),italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (46)

which contradicts the definition of x^^ùë•\widehat{x}over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG in Eq. 34 (i.e., x^^ùë•\widehat{x}over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG maximizes f‚Å¢(x;Œª1,Œª2)ùëìùë•subscriptùúÜ1subscriptùúÜ2f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )), completing the proof. ‚àé

Lemma I.2.

Suppose we have two series of functions {f1,i‚Å¢(x)}subscriptùëì1ùëñùë•\{f_{1,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) } and {f2,i‚Å¢(x)}subscriptùëì2ùëñùë•\{f_{2,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) }, with two series of non-negative weighting parameters ùõå1=[Œª1,i]i=1N,ùõå2=[Œª2,i]i=N+1Nsformulae-sequencesubscriptùõå1superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]subscriptùúÜ1ùëñùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùõå2subscriptsuperscriptdelimited-[]subscriptùúÜ2ùëñsubscriptùëÅùë†ùëñùëÅ1\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1}=[\lambda_{1,i}]_{i=1}^{N},\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}=[\lambda_{2,i}]^{N_{s}}_{i=N+1}bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying ‚àëi=1NŒª1,i+‚àëi=N+1NsŒª2,i=1superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1ùëñsuperscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùúÜ2ùëñ1\sum_{i=1}^{N}\lambda_{1,i}+\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}\lambda_{2,i}=1‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1. We define the final objective function f‚Å¢(‚ãÖ)ùëì‚ãÖf(\cdot)italic_f ( ‚ãÖ ) as:

f‚Å¢(x;ùùÄ1,ùùÄ2)=‚àëi=1NŒª1,i‚Å¢f1,i‚Å¢(x)+‚àëi=N+1NsŒª2,i‚Å¢f2,i‚Å¢(x).ùëìùë•subscriptùùÄ1subscriptùùÄ2superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëÅsubscriptùúÜ1ùëñsubscriptùëì1ùëñùë•superscriptsubscriptùëñùëÅ1subscriptùëÅùë†subscriptùúÜ2ùëñsubscriptùëì2ùëñùë•\displaystyle f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$% \lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})=\sum_{i=1}^{N}\lambda_{1,i}f_{1,i}(x)+\sum_{i=N+1}^{% N_{s}}\lambda_{2,i}f_{2,i}(x).italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) . (47)

We assume two pairs of parameters (ùõå1,ùõå2)subscriptùõå1subscriptùõå2(\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}% _{2})( bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and (ùõå1‚Ä≤,ùõå2‚Ä≤)subscriptsuperscriptùõå‚Ä≤1subscriptsuperscriptùõå‚Ä≤2(\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}^{\prime}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}^{\prime}_{2})( bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where

Œª1,i‚â•Œª1,i‚Ä≤,i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N},formulae-sequencesubscriptùúÜ1ùëñsubscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤1ùëñùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅ\displaystyle\lambda_{1,i}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1,i},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,...,N\},italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N } , (48)
Œª2,i‚â§Œª2,i‚Ä≤,i‚àà{N+1,N+2,‚Ä¶,Ns}.formulae-sequencesubscriptùúÜ2ùëñsubscriptsuperscriptùúÜ‚Ä≤2ùëñùëñùëÅ1ùëÅ2‚Ä¶subscriptùëÅùë†\displaystyle\lambda_{2,i}\leq\lambda^{\prime}_{2,i},~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,...,N% _{s}\}.italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ‚àà { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } . (49)

Defining the optimal values of the objective function for different weighting parameters as

x^=arg‚Å°maxx‚Å°f‚Å¢(x;ùùÄ1,ùùÄ2),^ùë•subscriptùë•ùëìùë•subscriptùùÄ1subscriptùùÄ2\displaystyle\widehat{x}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (50)
x^‚Ä≤=arg‚Å°maxx‚Å°f‚Å¢(x;ùùÄ1‚Ä≤,ùùÄ2‚Ä≤),superscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptùë•ùëìùë•subscriptsuperscriptùùÄ‚Ä≤1subscriptsuperscriptùùÄ‚Ä≤2\displaystyle\widehat{x}^{\prime}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}^{\prime}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}^{\prime}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (51)
x‚àó=arg‚Å°max‚Å°f‚Å¢(x,ùüèN,ùüé).superscriptùë•ùëìùë•1ùëÅ0\displaystyle x^{*}=\arg\max f(x,\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}).italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max italic_f ( italic_x , divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) . (52)

Under the following Assumptions (with ùüè1{\bf 1}bold_1 and ùüé0{\bf 0}bold_0 denoting vectors with all entries equal to 1111 and 00, respectively):

  1. 1.

    f‚Å¢(x^,ùüé,ùùÄ2)‚â§f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤,ùüé,ùùÄ2)ùëì^ùë•0subscriptùùÄ2ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤0subscriptùùÄ2f(\widehat{x},{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})\leq f(\widehat% {x}^{\prime},{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG , bold_0 , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚â§ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_0 , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  2. 2.

    f‚Å¢(x;ùùÄ,ùüé)‚â•f‚Å¢(x‚Ä≤;ùùÄ,ùüé)ùëìùë•ùùÄ0ùëìsuperscriptùë•‚Ä≤ùùÄ0f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath},{\bf 0})\geq f(x^{\prime};\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath},{\bf 0})italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_Œª , bold_0 ) ‚â• italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œª , bold_0 ), iff ‚Äñx‚àíx‚àó‚Äñ‚â§‚Äñx‚Ä≤‚àíx‚àó‚Äñ,ùùÄ‚â•0,‚ÄñùùÄ‚Äñ1=1formulae-sequencenormùë•superscriptùë•normsuperscriptùë•‚Ä≤superscriptùë•formulae-sequenceùùÄ0subscriptnormùùÄ11\|x-x^{*}\|\leq\|x^{\prime}-x^{*}\|,~{}~{}\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}% \geq 0,~{}~{}\|\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}\|_{1}=1‚à• italic_x - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• ‚â§ ‚à• italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• , bold_italic_Œª ‚â• 0 , ‚à• bold_italic_Œª ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1.

we have that

f‚Å¢(x^;ùüèN,ùüé)‚â•f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;ùüèN,ùüé).ùëì^ùë•1ùëÅ0ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤1ùëÅ0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0})\geq f(\widehat{x}^{% \prime};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) ‚â• italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) . (53)
Proof.

We start with proving the following equality by contradiction:

‚Äñx^‚àíx‚àó‚Äñ‚â§‚Äñx^‚Ä≤‚àíx‚àó‚Äñ.norm^ùë•superscriptùë•normsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤superscriptùë•\displaystyle\|\widehat{x}-x^{*}\|\leq\|\widehat{x}^{\prime}-x^{*}\|.‚à• over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• ‚â§ ‚à• over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• . (54)

Specifically, if

‚Äñx^‚àíx‚àó‚Äñ>‚Äñx^‚Ä≤‚àíx‚àó‚Äñ,norm^ùë•superscriptùë•normsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤superscriptùë•\displaystyle\|\widehat{x}-x^{*}\|>\|\widehat{x}^{\prime}-x^{*}\|,‚à• over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• > ‚à• over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• , (55)

leveraging the Assumption 1 and 2 above, we have that

f‚Å¢(x^;ùùÄ1,ùùÄ2)=f‚Å¢(x^;ùùÄ1,ùüé)+f‚Å¢(x^;ùüé,ùùÄ2)<f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;ùùÄ1,ùüé)+f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;ùüé,ùùÄ2)=f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;ùùÄ1,ùùÄ2),ùëì^ùë•subscriptùùÄ1subscriptùùÄ2ùëì^ùë•subscriptùùÄ10ùëì^ùë•0subscriptùùÄ2ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptùùÄ10ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤0subscriptùùÄ2ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤subscriptùùÄ1subscriptùùÄ2\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1},\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})=f(\widehat{x};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{1},{\bf 0})+f(\widehat{x};{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{2})<f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},{\bf 0})+f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{2})=f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}),italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_0 ) + italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_0 , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_0 ) + italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_0 , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (56)

which contradicts Eq. 50. Therefore,  Eq. 54 holds.

Combining Eq. 54 and Assumption 2 above, we have that

f‚Å¢(x^;ùüèN,ùüé)‚â•f‚Å¢(x^‚Ä≤;ùüèN,ùüé),ùëì^ùë•1ùëÅ0ùëìsuperscript^ùë•‚Ä≤1ùëÅ0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0})\geq f(\widehat{x}^{% \prime};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}),italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) ‚â• italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) , (57)

concluding the proof. ‚àé

Based on the definitions and lemmas above, we have the following theorems:

Theorem I.3 (Advantage of ùöØAsubscriptùöØùê¥\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the Simplified Case).

With Definition I.1 and Definition I.3, comparing ùöØIsubscriptùöØùêº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ùöØGsubscriptùöØùê∫\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ùöØAsubscriptùöØùê¥\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., ‚Ñí‚Å¢(‚ãÖ,w‚ÜíGT)‚Ñí‚Üí‚ãÖùë§GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ‚ãÖ , italic_w ‚Üí GT ), we have that

‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØI;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùêºùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (58)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that ùöØGsubscriptùöØùê∫\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest ‚Ñí‚Å¢(‚ãÖ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚Ñí‚Üí‚ãÖùê∞GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ‚ãÖ ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) among the three:

max‚Å°[‚ÑíG‚Å¢M‚Å¢M‚Å¢(ùöØI;ùê∞‚ÜíGT),‚ÑíG‚Å¢M‚Å¢M‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)]‚â§maxùöØ‚Å°‚ÑíG‚Å¢M‚Å¢M‚Å¢(ùöØ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)=‚ÑíG‚Å¢M‚Å¢M‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚Ñíùê∫ùëÄùëÄ‚ÜísubscriptùöØùêºùê∞GTsubscript‚Ñíùê∫ùëÄùëÄ‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscriptùöØsubscript‚Ñíùê∫ùëÄùëÄ‚ÜíùöØùê∞GTsubscript‚Ñíùê∫ùëÄùëÄ‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}% _{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{% GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ] ‚â§ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Œò end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (59)

Next, we set {wi}i=1Nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùë§ùëñùëñ1ùëÅ\{w_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to Œª1subscriptùúÜ1\lambda_{1}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and {wi}i=N+1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùë§ùëñùëñùëÅ1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†\{w_{i}\}_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to Œª2subscriptùúÜ2\lambda_{2}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively; we rewrite log‚Å¢‚àëk=1KœÄk‚Å¢ùí©‚Å¢(ùêûi;ùùÅk,ùö∫k)superscriptsubscriptùëò1ùêæsubscriptùúãùëòùí©subscriptùêûùëñsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëò\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})roman_log ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) as f1,i‚Å¢(x)subscriptùëì1ùëñùë•f_{1,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N}ùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅi\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N } and f2,i‚Å¢(x)subscriptùëì2ùëñùë•f_{2,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for i‚àà{N+1,N+1,‚Ä¶,N+Ns}ùëñùëÅ1ùëÅ1‚Ä¶ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†i\in\{N+1,N+1,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i ‚àà { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 1 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where xùë•xitalic_x corresponds to ùöØ‚âú(ùùÖ,{ùùÅk,ùö∫k}k=1K)‚âúùöØùùÖsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòùëò1ùêæ\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}% ,\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k% }\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Œò ‚âú ( bold_italic_œÄ , { bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). By Lemma I.1, we have that

‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (60)

Combining Eq. 59 and Eq. 60 concludes the proof. ‚àé

Theorem I.3 shows that under mild assumptions, the attention-based weights can help produce better estimates of ùöØùöØ\Thetabold_Œò in the presence of noisy stop-words and therefore learns higher-quality topics from the corpus, improving interpretability of FLMs.

Theorem I.4 (Advantage of ùöØAsubscriptùöØùê¥\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the General Case).

With Definition I.2 and Definition I.3, comparing ùöØIsubscriptùöØùêº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ùöØGsubscriptùöØùê∫\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ùöØAsubscriptùöØùê¥\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., ‚ÑíG‚Å¢M‚Å¢M‚Å¢(‚ãÖ,w‚ÜíGT)subscript‚Ñíùê∫ùëÄùëÄ‚Üí‚ãÖùë§GT\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚ãÖ , italic_w ‚Üí GT ), we have that

‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØI;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùêºùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (61)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that ùöØGsubscriptùöØùê∫\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest ‚Ñí‚Å¢(‚ãÖ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚Ñí‚Üí‚ãÖùê∞GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ‚ãÖ ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) among the three:

max‚Å°[‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØI;ùê∞‚ÜíGT),‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)]‚â§maxùöØ‚Å°‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)=‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùêºùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscriptùöØsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜíùöØùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}% _{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w% }\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G% };{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ] ‚â§ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Œò end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (62)

Next, we invoke Lemma I.2 by (1) setting {wi}i=1Nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùë§ùëñùëñ1ùëÅ\{w_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to ùùÄ1subscriptùùÄ1\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1}bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and {wi}i=N+1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùë§ùëñùëñùëÅ1ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†\{w_{i}\}_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to ùùÄ2subscriptùùÄ2\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively, and (2) rewriting log‚Å¢‚àëk=1KœÄk‚Å¢ùí©‚Å¢(ùêûi;ùùÅk,ùö∫k)superscriptsubscriptùëò1ùêæsubscriptùúãùëòùí©subscriptùêûùëñsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëò\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})roman_log ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_œÄ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) as f1,i‚Å¢(x)subscriptùëì1ùëñùë•f_{1,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for i‚àà{1,2,‚Ä¶,N}ùëñ12‚Ä¶ùëÅi\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}italic_i ‚àà { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N } and f2,i‚Å¢(x)subscriptùëì2ùëñùë•f_{2,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for i‚àà{N+1,N+1,‚Ä¶,N+Ns}ùëñùëÅ1ùëÅ1‚Ä¶ùëÅsubscriptùëÅùë†i\in\{N+1,N+1,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i ‚àà { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 1 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where xùë•xitalic_x corresponds to ùöØ‚âú(ùùÖ,{ùùÅk,ùö∫k}k=1K)‚âúùöØùùÖsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòùëò1ùêæ\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}% ,\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k% }\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Œò ‚âú ( bold_italic_œÄ , { bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). By Lemma I.2, we then have that

‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíGMM‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíGMM‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (63)

Note that because f1,i‚Å¢(‚ãÖ)subscriptùëì1ùëñ‚ãÖf_{1,i}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚ãÖ ) and f2,i‚Å¢(‚ãÖ)subscriptùëì2ùëñ‚ãÖf_{2,i}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚ãÖ ) are Gaussian, therefore Assumption 1 and 2 in Lemma I.2 hold naturally under mild regularity conditions.

Combining Eq. 62 and Eq. 63 concludes the proof. ‚àé

I.2 VALC as Interpreters

As mentioned in Eq. B , the ELBO of the marginal likelihood (denoting as ùöØùöØ\Thetabold_Œò the collection of parameters œï,ùú∏bold-italic-œïùú∏\mbox{\boldmath$\phi$\unboldmath},\mbox{\boldmath$\gamma$\unboldmath}bold_italic_œï , bold_italic_Œ≥ and {ùùÅk,ùö∫k}k=1KsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòùëò1ùêæ\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}% \}_{k=1}^{K}{ bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT) is as follows:

‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØ;{wi})subscript‚ÑíVALCùöØsubscriptùë§ùëñ\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};\{w% _{i}\})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò ; { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ) =‚àëj=1L‚Ä≤ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j|zm‚Å¢j,ùùÅzm‚Å¢j,ùö∫zm‚Å¢j)]absentsuperscriptsubscriptùëó1superscriptùêø‚Ä≤subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëùconditionalsubscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùëßùëöùëósubscriptùùÅsubscriptùëßùëöùëósubscriptùö∫subscriptùëßùëöùëó\displaystyle=\sum\nolimits_{j=1}^{L^{\prime}}{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log p({\bf e}_% {mj}|z_{mj},\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{z_{mj}},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$% \unboldmath}_{z_{mj}})]= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=‚àëm,jwm‚Å¢j‚Å¢‚àëkœïm‚Å¢j‚Å¢k‚Å¢{‚àí12‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j‚àíùùÅk)T‚Å¢ùö∫k‚àí1‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j‚àíùùÅk)‚àílog‚Å°[(2‚Å¢œÄ)H/2‚Å¢|ùö∫k|1/2]}.absentsubscriptùëöùëósubscriptùë§ùëöùëósubscriptùëòsubscriptitalic-œïùëöùëóùëò12superscriptsubscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùùÅùëòùëásuperscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëò1subscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùùÅùëòsuperscript2ùúãùêª2superscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëò12\displaystyle=\sum_{m,j}w_{mj}\sum_{k}\phi_{mjk}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{% k}^{-1}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})-\log[(2\pi)^{H/2}|% \mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}|^{1/2}]\}.= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_œÄ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } . (64)

Based on the definitions and lemmas above, we have the following theorems:

Theorem I.5 (Advantage of ùöØAsubscriptùöØùê¥\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the Simplified Case).

With Definition I.1 and Definition I.3, comparing ùöØIsubscriptùöØùêº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ùöØGsubscriptùöØùê∫\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ùöØAsubscriptùöØùê¥\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., ‚Ñí‚Å¢(‚ãÖ,w‚ÜíGT)‚Ñí‚Üí‚ãÖùë§GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ‚ãÖ , italic_w ‚Üí GT ), we have that

‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØI;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùêºùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (65)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that ùöØGsubscriptùöØùê∫\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest ‚Ñí‚Å¢(‚ãÖ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚Ñí‚Üí‚ãÖùê∞GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ‚ãÖ ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) among the three:

max‚Å°[‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØI;ùê∞‚ÜíGT),‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)]‚â§maxùöØ‚Å°‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)=‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùêºùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscriptùöØsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜíùöØùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath% }_{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ] ‚â§ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Œò end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (66)

Next, we set ‚à™m{wm‚Å¢j}j=1Nmsubscriptùëösuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùë§ùëöùëóùëó1subscriptùëÅùëö\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=1}^{N_{m}}‚à™ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to Œª1subscriptùúÜ1\lambda_{1}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ‚à™m{wm‚Å¢j}j=Nm+1Nm+Nm,ssubscriptùëösuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùë§ùëöùëóùëósubscriptùëÅùëö1subscriptùëÅùëösubscriptùëÅùëöùë†\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=N_{m}+1}^{N_{m}+N_{m,s}}‚à™ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to Œª2subscriptùúÜ2\lambda_{2}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively; we rewrite ‚àëiœïm‚Å¢j‚Å¢i‚Å¢{‚àí12‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j‚àíùùÅi)T‚Å¢ùö∫i‚àí1‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j‚àíùùÅi)‚àílog‚Å°[(2‚Å¢œÄ)d/2‚Å¢|ùö∫i|1/2]}subscriptùëñsubscriptitalic-œïùëöùëóùëñ12superscriptsubscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùùÅùëñùëásuperscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëñ1subscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùùÅùëñsuperscript2ùúãùëë2superscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëñ12\sum_{i}\phi_{mji}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath% }_{i})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{i}^{-1}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{% \boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{i})-\log[(2\pi)^{d/2}|\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$% \unboldmath}_{i}|^{1/2}]\}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_œÄ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } as f1,j‚Å¢(x)subscriptùëì1ùëóùë•f_{1,j}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for j‚àà‚à™m{1,2,‚Ä¶,Nm}ùëósubscriptùëö12‚Ä¶subscriptùëÅùëöj\in\cup_{m}\{1,2,\dots,N_{m}\}italic_j ‚àà ‚à™ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { 1 , 2 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and f2,j‚Å¢(x)subscriptùëì2ùëóùë•f_{2,j}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for j‚àà‚à™m{Nm+1,Nm+1,‚Ä¶,Nm+Nm,s}ùëósubscriptùëösubscriptùëÅùëö1subscriptùëÅùëö1‚Ä¶subscriptùëÅùëösubscriptùëÅùëöùë†j\in\cup_{m}\{N_{m}+1,N_{m}+1,\dots,N_{m}+N_{m,s}\}italic_j ‚àà ‚à™ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where xùë•xitalic_x corresponds to ùöØ‚âú(œï,ùú∏,{ùùÅk,ùö∫k}k=1K)‚âúùöØbold-italic-œïùú∏superscriptsubscriptsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòùëò1ùêæ\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\phi$\unboldmath% },\mbox{\boldmath$\gamma$\unboldmath},\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},% \mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Œò ‚âú ( bold_italic_œï , bold_italic_Œ≥ , { bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). By Lemma I.1, we have that

‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (67)

Combining Eq. 66 and Eq. 67 concludes the proof. ‚àé

Theorem I.5 shows that under mild assumptions, the attention-based weights can help produce better estimates of ùöØùöØ\Thetabold_Œò in the presence of noisy stop-words and therefore learns higher-quality topics from the corpus, improving and interpretability of FLMs.

Theorem I.6 (Advantage of ùöØAsubscriptùöØùê¥\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the General Case).

With Definition I.2 and Definition I.3, comparing ùöØIsubscriptùöØùêº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ùöØGsubscriptùöØùê∫\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ùöØAsubscriptùöØùê¥\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., ‚ÑíV‚Å¢A‚Å¢L‚Å¢C‚Å¢(‚ãÖ,w‚ÜíGT)subscript‚Ñíùëâùê¥ùêøùê∂‚Üí‚ãÖùë§GT\mathcal{L}_{VALC}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V italic_A italic_L italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚ãÖ , italic_w ‚Üí GT ), we have that

‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØI;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùêºùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (68)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that ùöØGsubscriptùöØùê∫\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest ‚Ñí‚Å¢(‚ãÖ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚Ñí‚Üí‚ãÖùê∞GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ‚ãÖ ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) among the three:

max‚Å°[‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØI;ùê∞‚ÜíGT),‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)]‚â§maxùöØ‚Å°‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØ;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)=‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùêºùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscriptùöØsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜíùöØùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath% }_{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ] ‚â§ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Œò end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (69)

Next, we invoke Lemma I.2 by (1) setting ‚à™m{wm‚Å¢j}j=1Nmsubscriptùëösuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùë§ùëöùëóùëó1subscriptùëÅùëö\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=1}^{N_{m}}‚à™ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to ùùÄ1subscriptùùÄ1\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1}bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ‚à™m{wm‚Å¢j}j=Nm+1Nm+Nm,ssubscriptùëösuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptùë§ùëöùëóùëósubscriptùëÅùëö1subscriptùëÅùëösubscriptùëÅùëöùë†\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=N_{m}+1}^{N_{m}+N_{m,s}}‚à™ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to ùùÄ2subscriptùùÄ2\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}bold_italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively, and (2) rewriting ‚àëiœïm‚Å¢j‚Å¢i‚Å¢{‚àí12‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j‚àíùùÅi)T‚Å¢ùö∫i‚àí1‚Å¢(ùêûm‚Å¢j‚àíùùÅi)‚àílog‚Å°[(2‚Å¢œÄ)d/2‚Å¢|ùö∫i|1/2]}subscriptùëñsubscriptitalic-œïùëöùëóùëñ12superscriptsubscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùùÅùëñùëásuperscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëñ1subscriptùêûùëöùëósubscriptùùÅùëñsuperscript2ùúãùëë2superscriptsubscriptùö∫ùëñ12\sum_{i}\phi_{mji}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Œº start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where xùë•xitalic_x corresponds to ùöØ‚âú(œï,ùú∏,{ùùÅk,ùö∫k}k=1K)‚âúùöØbold-italic-œïùú∏superscriptsubscriptsubscriptùùÅùëòsubscriptùö∫ùëòùëò1ùêæ\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\phi$\unboldmath% start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Œ£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). By Lemma I.2, we then have that

‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØA;ùê∞‚ÜíGT)‚â§‚ÑíVALC‚Å¢(ùöØG;ùê∞‚ÜíGT).subscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê¥ùê∞GTsubscript‚ÑíVALC‚ÜísubscriptùöØùê∫ùê∞GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) ‚â§ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Œò start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w ‚Üí GT ) . (70)

Note that because f1,j‚Å¢(‚ãÖ)subscriptùëì1ùëó‚ãÖf_{1,j}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚ãÖ ) and f2,j‚Å¢(‚ãÖ)subscriptùëì2ùëó‚ãÖf_{2,j}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚ãÖ ) are very close to Gaussian, therefore Assumption 1 and 2 in Lemma I.2 hold naturally under mild regularity conditions.

Combining Eq. 69 and Eq. 70 concludes the proof. ‚àé

Report Github Issue
Generated by L A T E xml

Instructions for reporting errors

We are continuing to improve HTML versions of papers, and your feedback helps enhance accessibility and mobile support. To report errors in the HTML that will help us improve conversion and rendering, choose any of the methods listed below:

  • Click the "Report Issue" button.
  • Open a report feedback form via keyboard, use "Ctrl + ?".
  • Make a text selection and click the "Report Issue for Selection" button near your cursor.
  • You can use Alt+Y to toggle on and Alt+Shift+Y to toggle off accessible reporting links at each section.

Our team has already identified the following issues. We appreciate your time reviewing and reporting rendering errors we may not have found yet. Your efforts will help us improve the HTML versions for all readers, because disability should not be a barrier to accessing research. Thank you for your continued support in championing open access for all.

Have a free development cycle? Help support accessibility at arXiv! Our collaborators at LaTeXML maintain a list of packages that need conversion, and welcome developer contributions.
